I think this game blends movement and team shooters perfectly. The skill ceiling is extremely high and even people with thousands of hours can still improve. Even new players have fun because the movement and combat feels very fair. Very good game; everyone should play it.

TF2 is perhaps my favorite game.

So, I LIKED this game for the first 50 hours or so. However, recently it feels like I've crossed a threshold that has taken this game from a fun replacement for Paladins, to near unplayable (while having fun, that is). 

My major complaint as of late is the fact that searches (casual searches, I never touched comp) are taking upwards of 5 minutes, only to land in a terrible game. I'm constantly rubber banding, in some cases quite severly. The teams have been terribly one-sided, with 3-4 members of the other team being tier three or four playes and mine having only tier ones or zeros. 

This game has some decent mechanics and fun gameplay - when the matches actually work and are balanced. 

While reading through some of the other reviews, it seems the comp scene is almost entirely elitist, not allowing new players to actually JOIN the competitive scene without first having a good team setup before hand that will carry them.

I would love to return to this game once the devs stop adding new weapons that simply overcrowd an already well established class (pyro), and start tweaking and fixing what they DO have.

[h1] Its what every FPS shooter should strive to be. [/h1]
Team Fortress 2 came out in 2007, and it hasn't aged a day since. The graphics are beautifully stylized to look cartoony, yet with a little bit of realism. The cosmetics [strike] (most of them) [/strike] keep the art style in check. Ive never found a game where killing people is this fun. The movement is beautiful, the shooting is top notch; the maps are amazing. Its truly a work of art that has been in the works for many years and hopefully still will be.
Ive been playing tf2 since 2012 (ive lost my first account) and its a game that really can change a man. Its practically timeless and you can play it anywhere at anytime and still have a blast. Whether you're just starting out, or you're a veteran in the game, you're in for a rollercoaster of enjoyment sprinkled with just a little bit of bullshit [strike] (cough cough, random crits) [/strike] .

Honestly speaking there is so much to do in this game and so much to explore, i doubt anyone can do everything within 2 thousand hours. Things range from fun shooting to actual trading, it's wild and i highly recommend others to try this because its an experience you wont forget easily.

I love this game. It's a little dated, but it's always a blast to play every time I go back to it. Thank you TF2.


Update: Still there, still awesome. Please update this Valve. Keep the love alive!

This game is the gateway to PC gaming, but still has a lot to be improved. Remove Random Crits from casual, improve the Anti-Cheat and remove the cl_interp console command exploit, and this game would be way more enjoyable.
There are also a lot of weapons that are so bad that they aren't used. Buff those weapons, nerf the ones that are too OP and TF2 would be a near-perfect game.
